comments:
Build ID: I20070621-1340

Steps To Reproduce:
1. Get the source code from http://eclipsercp.org/book/RCP-book-CD.zip for the Hyperbola chat client
2. Import the project from chapter 10 (Messaging Support) org.jivesoftware.smack
3. Import the project from chapter 11 (Adding a Login Dialog) org.eclipsercp.hyperbola
4. Run the product.
5. Login using valid credentials.
6. The application crashes.
7. Rename the file 'splash.bmp' to something else ('splash.bm' for example)
8. Run the product.
9. Login using the same credentials
10. The application works (no crash and you can chat)



More information:
On Windows XP SP2 using Sun's JRE 1.5.0_12 after connecting to a Jabber Server and receiving the Roster the application exits caused by a SWTError telling that there are no more handles. In the .metadata directory there is a log file, see below.

Using Eclipse 3.1 Build id I20050627-1435 (same WXP and JRE) there is no problem.

Using Eclipse 3.3 Build id I20070621-1340 on Ubuntu 7.04 and Sun's JRE 1.5.0_11 there is no problem.

After renaming the spalsh image 'splash.bmp' to 'splash.bm' on WXP using Eclipse 3.3 there is no problem.  

It looks like a bug in the UI or Windows SWT code to me. Probably in  BasicSplashHandler.getBundleProgressMonitor(), line 602.
